DOC.brief_title: Post Market Study 3DKnee™ With E-plus Insert
DOC.detailed_description: Total knee replacement surgery widely accept effective treatment degenerative joint disease ( DJD ) , osteoarthritis rheumatoid arthritis . Relief patient pain return mobility primary goal accomplish surgery . Currently available prosthetic design accomplish goal surgery define one successful operation available improve quality life patient DJD . This study evaluate subject candidate total knee replacement meet indication use criterion 3DKnee™ System vitamin E UHMWPE tibial insert ( VE ) .
DOC.criteria: Subject must candidate total primary knee replacement . Subject must knee joint disease relate degenerative joint disease , include osteoarthritis traumatic arthritis Subject BMI ≤ 40.00 kg/m2 Subject likely available evaluation duration study Subject able willing sign inform consent follow study procedure Subject pregnant Subject must age 40 age 75 time consent Subject prior total uniknee replacement knee past ( revision allow study ) Subject avascular necrosis femoral condyle , posttraumatic loss joint configuration , particularly patellofemoral erosion , dysfunction prior patellectomy , moderate valgus , varus , flexion deformity rheumatoid arthritis Subject active cancer survivor < 5 year except squamous cell basal cell skin cancer Subject chronic disease ( ) , opinion investigator , disease interfere patient 's ability follow protocol Subject currently document substance abuser ( alcohol addiction ) Subject infection , history infection ( within last 3 month ) , acute chronic , local systemic Subject history muscular , neurological vascular deficiency compromise affected extremity Subject BMI > 40.00 kg/m2 Subject loss ligamentous structure Subject high level physical activity unwilling modify level physical activity commensurate recommendation Subject mental condition may interfere subject 's ability give inform consent willingness fulfill study requirement ( i.e. , severe mental retardation Subject understand inform consent process , global dementia , prior stroke interfere Subject 's cognitive ability , senile dementia , Alzheimer 's Disease ) Subject prisoner Subject pregnant Subject know material sensitivity ( metal ) Subject young 40 year ( < 40 ) old 75 year ( > 75 ) time consent
